intro: Chelonecarya, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its unique, bell-shaped flowers that often display a striking white or pale blue color. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and is native to regions in eastern North America. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stems. Chelonecarya species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
